intro: Schizoglossum ingomense, commonly known as the Ingomense spurge, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native region. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Schizoglossum ingomense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its habitat.
